intro: Paesia divaricatissima, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in alpine and subalpine environments. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves and produces small, white or pink flowers in late spring to early summer. Its flowering stems are usually erect and branched, bearing clusters of small, delicate blooms. Paesia divaricatissima is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
